result.execSummary:
The defendant John B. Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.05(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution due to Crime Victim Compensation is to be paid first.  Restitution due to Z.K. is ordered joint and several with Brandon Lomax in Jackson County Case No. 14CF94.   Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Seek and maintain employment, at his agent's discretion.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, or through any other means with the victim's immediate family, unless they request contact. Also, no contact with Harley Est, Jason Carroll, Aron Fogleson, Brandon Lomax or Rebecca Necomish, unless his agent gives prior permission.    No contact with any known illegal drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision  conditions.

Follow all recommendations of his agent.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Not to possess any weapons, including knifes.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John B. Cook

defendant.name: Cook, John B.
defendant.address: 30 North 3rd St., c/o Jackson County Jail, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing Hearing March 21, 2017

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorneys Sebion and Kuczynski.  Agent who prepared the PSI present in court.  Court noted that the PSI recommendation for extended supervision is in error. State correction:  14CF93.  Restitution, joint and several $99.95, plus surcharges.  Defense agrees.  Victim notification complied with.  Parents of the victim wish to make statements.  Father, G.M. made a statement to the court. Mother, J.B. made a statement to the court.  State recommended:  Total sentence of: 60 years.  Bifurcated as 40 years initial confinement, 20 years extended supervision.  Defense recommended:  27-32  years initial confinement, and 20  years extended supervision.  Parties stipulate to credit for 674 days.

Court ordered:  Total sentence of: 60 years.  Bifurcated as 40 years initial confinement, and 20 years extended supervision.  Credit for 674 days.  CC.  Restitution of $99.95 joint and several with B.L. from read in case number 14CF93. Plus restitution of $1,458.01 in this case (priority).  Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. Not eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Extended supervision conditions:  No contact with the victim's immediate family, unless they request.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Follow any recommendations of agent.  AODA and recommended treatment.   DNA sample.  Subject to random drug/alcohol testing on demand.  CC.  No contact with known drug users or dealers. H.E,. R.N, J.C., B.L. or A.F. unless agent gives prior permission.  Seek and maintain employment, at agent's discretion.  Follow mental health recommendations.  Not to possess any weapons.
Victim Impact GM.  Sent to Judge.  JMM
from M.C.  Sent to Judge for review
returned exparte communication to sender with standard exparte response.
Copies of the read in complaints.  Numbers: 12CF70, 12CF164, 14CF93 and 15CF26.
Sentencing hearing on March 21, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorneys Sebion and Kuczynski.   Amended information filed with the court. Amended to 2nd degree intentional homicide.  Class B Felony.  Victim notification complied with.  Discussion held and defense agrees to waive any conflict the court may have in the cases that are contemplated to be read in.  Reading of the amended information waived.  Defendant plead guilty to the amended charge.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of 2nd degree intentional homicide, contrary to 940.05(1)(b).  Case No. 12CF70, 12CF164, 14CF93 and 15CF26 read in for sentencing purposes.  PSI ordered due March 1.  Sentencing set for 3/21/17 2:30 - 4:30.
With 1 attachment (routed to Judge)
Plea hearing on December 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 18, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 28, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on May 3, 2017 at 08:00 am.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Attorneys Sebion and Kuczynski appeared for defendant.  Set for motion hearing date.  Set for 3 week jury trial.  Voir Dire of 100 needed.  2 days needed for voir dire.
Status conference on October 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorneys Sebion and Kuczynski.  Set for STC 10/17 at 3 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for John B. Cook
Current: 30 North 3rd St., c/o Jackson County Jail, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2016)
Prior: 517 Court St., Room 308, c/o Clark County Jail, Neillsville, WI 54456 United States
Status conference on September 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
RE:  Motion to Suppress.
State's Brief in Opposition to Motion to Suppress.  DA gave a copy to the Judge's office.
In Support of Motion to Suppress - Defendant's (routed to Judge)
of 5/6/16 motion hearing.
Judge kept Exhibit 1 - flash drive to review interviews

1 - Flash Drive  (In Clerk of Court's exhibit closet)
2 - Blood test results
3 - JASO Visitor Log
4 - Email

Defendant appears in custody with counsel SPD's Paul Fredrickson and Carly Sebion.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  There are 2 issues to address today.  DA Fox calls 1st witness, E.M.  All witnesses sequestered as requested.  E.M., sworn, testifies.  States what evidence was collected and how it was collected at BRMH.  Record reflects ID of the defendant.  Did not interrogate him or ask any questions.  He was cooperative and appeared to understand.  No indicia on impairment noted.  Defense questions witness.  State calls witness, K.B., sworn, testifies.  Did not speak to him when he was first in custody as he appeared to be under the influence of something, possibly meth after observing him.  Met with him the next day at 10:52 a.m. in an interview room at JASO.  Record reflects ID of defendant by witness.  Describes how she read and explained his Miranda Rights and what the procdure was.  Interview recorded with both audio and video.  He never asked to end the interview.  USB/flash drive from witness will be marked as Exh. 1 which include the interviews.  DA Fox plays a portion of 1st interview.  2nd interview took place on May 19th in the Intoximeter Room and re-Mirandaized him.  Exhibit 2 marked - Lab Report for blood results.  Exhibit 2 offered/admitted.  Meth present in his system.  A meth high is relatively short, 3-4 hours.  He was no longer high on May 18th or 19th when interviewed.  Exhibit 1 is admitted into evidence.  SPD Paul Fredrickson cross-examines witness.  Re-direct by DA.  No re-cross by defense.  State calls next witness, T.C., sworn, testifies.  Witness ID's defendant.  Describes call received, arrest, and what took place at jail.  States what items were found next to the defendant and what he did with them.  Witness excused.  State has no more witnesses, rests.  Defense calls witness, M.R., sworn, testifies regarding May 19th, explained visitor's log.  Exhibit 3 marked - Visitor Log, witness testifies to exhibit.  Continues further questioning.  DA Fox cross-examines the witness.  Re-direct by SPD Sebion.  Exhibit 3 offered/admitted.  Exhibit 4 marked - Email to witness.  Exhibit 4 offered/admitted.  Defense calls S.B,. sworn, testifies.  May 19th received audio disks of phone calls.  Defendant asked his mother to get him a lawyer in one of the calls.  State has no questions for witness.  No further witnesses to be called by defense.  Defense asks Court to watch entire interviews on Exhibit 1 and to set a briefing schedule; and transcripts requested.  Defense brief due June 20; State's reply brief due by July 8th.  Hearing will be scheduled after briefs are filed or a written decision will be done.  Will be determined after briefs are filed.  Defense states they are still waiting for some discovery and will send a list to DA of what has not been received yet.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson and Attorney Sebion.  State called Det. K.B.  Sworn.  State questioned the detective regarding the 5/17/15 incident and investigation. Venue established.  Attorney Sebion and Attorney Fredrickson questioned the detective.  State redirect.  Witness identified the defendant.  Record reflects indentification of the defendant.  Attorney Sebion, recross.  State called Officer T.C.  City of Black River Falls Police Dept.  Sworn.  State questioned witness.  Witness identified the defendant.  Record reflects indentification of the defendant.  Attorney Fredrickson and Attorney Sebion questioned the witness.  State moved for bind over.  No witnesses for the defense.  Court finds probable cause.

Defendant's
Preliminary hearing at 08-18-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant appeared in custody with counsels SPD's Carly Sebion and Paul Fredrickson.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defense counsel states they have received the complaint and waive the reading.  Court reviews the charges and potential penalites.  Defense will waive the time limits for a preliminary hearing to be scheduled but request the prelim be scheduled for 1 hour.  Court reviews time limit with defendant and finds he knowingly and intelligently waives the right to have a preliminary hearing within the time limits.  Defense counsel is to schedule the preliminary hearing for 1 hour.  Bond is continued.
